pcs 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • A worked example with `pcs`

Main PCS scraping function

Source: R/query_pcs.R
query_pcs.Rd

query_pcs scrapes PCS data (rider profiles and results) for a given vector of rider names.

query_pcs(rider_names, seasons = NULL)

Arguments

rider_names

Character vector containing one or more rider names.
seasons

Integer vector of years ("seasons") to collect results from. Will return all years if NULL.

Value

List of two data frames (profiles and results).

The results data frame contains the following:

  • date: Date of race.

  • result: Race result.

  • gc_result_on_stage: If a race was a stage race, gives the rider's placement overall following the stage.

  • race: Race name.

  • distance: Race distance (km).

  • pointspcs: PCS points awarded.

  • pointsuci: UCI points awarded.

  • stage: Type of race (one day, stage race, etc).

  • rider: Rider name.

  • team: Team name.

The profiles data frame contains the following:

  • rider: Rider name.

  • dob: Date of birth.

  • Nationality

  • pob: Place of birth.

  • current_team: Current team.

  • weight: Weight in kg.

  • height: Height in m.

  • one_day_races: Career points awarded for success in one day races.

  • gc: Career points awarded for success in grand tours.

  • tt: Career points awarded for success in time trials.

  • sprint: Career points awarded for success in sprint-focused races.

  • climber: Career points awarded for success in climbing-focused races.

Examples


# race results for two riders in the 2021 season
query_pcs(c("Peter Sagan","Adam Yates"), seasons = 2021)

#> Peter Sagan
#> Peter Sagan 2021
#> Adam Yates
#> Adam Yates 2021
#> $profiles
#> # A tibble: 2 × 12
#>   rider   dob        nationality pob   current_team  weight height one_day_races
#>   <chr>   <date>     <chr>       <chr> <chr>          <dbl>  <dbl>         <dbl>
#> 1 Adam Y… 1992-08-07 Great Brit… ""    INEOS Grenad…     58   1.73          1662
#> 2 Peter … 1990-01-26 Slovakia    ""    BORA - hansg…     78   1.84          9134
#> # … with 4 more variables: gc <dbl>, tt <dbl>, sprint <dbl>, climber <dbl>
#> 
#> $results
#> # A tibble: 150 × 10
#>    race    stage  date                result gc_result_on_st… distance pointspcs
#>    <chr>   <chr>  <dttm>               <dbl>            <int>    <dbl>     <int>
#>  1 Itzuli… Mount… 2021-04-05 00:00:00     13               NA       NA        NA
#>  2 Itzuli… Point… 2021-04-05 00:00:00      7               NA       NA        NA
#>  3 Itzuli… Gener… 2021-04-05 00:00:00      4               NA       NA       140
#>  4 La Vue… Mount… 2021-08-14 00:00:00     28               NA       NA        NA
#>  5 La Vue… Point… 2021-08-14 00:00:00     12               NA       NA        NA
#>  6 La Vue… Gener… 2021-08-14 00:00:00      4               NA       NA       220
#>  7 UAE To… Point… 2021-02-21 00:00:00      8               NA       NA        NA
#>  8 UAE To… Gener… 2021-02-21 00:00:00      2               NA       NA       150
#>  9 Volta … Mount… 2021-03-22 00:00:00      2               NA       NA        NA
#> 10 Volta … Point… 2021-03-22 00:00:00      5               NA       NA        NA
#> # … with 140 more rows, and 3 more variables: pointsuci <int>, rider <chr>,
#> #   team <chr>
#> 

# two riders, two seasons
query_pcs(c("Peter Sagan","Adam Yates"), seasons = c(2020,2021))

#> Peter Sagan
#> Peter Sagan 2021
#> Peter Sagan 2020
#> Adam Yates
#> Adam Yates 2021
#> Adam Yates 2020
#> $profiles
#> # A tibble: 2 × 12
#>   rider   dob        nationality pob   current_team  weight height one_day_races

#> 2 Peter … 1990-01-26 Slovakia    ""    BORA - hansg…     78   1.84          9134

#>  1 Itzuli… Mount… 2021-04-05 00:00:00     13               NA       NA        NA
#>  2 Itzuli… Point… 2021-04-05 00:00:00      7               NA       NA        NA

# two riders, all seasons
query_pcs(c("Peter Sagan","Adam Yates"))
